meanings.definition: Ditsier (comparative form of ditsy): More scatterbrained or silly.
meanings.sent1: She became even ditsier after forgetting her keys for the third time.
meanings.sent2: Her ditsier behavior was evident when she wore mismatched socks to work.
meanings.sent3: Despite her ditsier moments, she always managed to make everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a ditsier maze than a confusing puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The ditsier she acted, the more endearing she became to her friends.

meanings.definition: Ditsier (adjective): Characterized by being scatterbrained or silly.
meanings.sent1: The ditsier cat kept chasing its own tail in circles.
meanings.sent2: His ditsier nature often led to hilarious misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The ditsier the situation, the more laughter it brought.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a ditsier mess than a tornado aftermath.
meanings.sent5: The ditsier he acted, the more everyone adored his quirky personality.

meanings.definition: Ditsier (adverb): In a scatterbrained or silly manner.
meanings.sent1: She giggled ditsier as the comedy show went on.
meanings.sent2: He danced ditsier than anyone at the party, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent3: The clown performed ditsier than usual, causing uproarious laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts raced ditsier than a squirrel gathering nuts.
meanings.sent5: The children played ditsier, creating a joyful chaos in the park.
